election_record.label: New York 1815 State Senate, Eastern District

sub_unit.name: Albany
sub_unit.note: Henry Frey received 1 vote as Henry J. Frey.

sub_unit.name: One
sub_unit.note: Several newspapers list Benjamin Smith with 75 votes and Abraham Van Vechten with 101 votes.

sub_unit.name: Two
sub_unit.note: Several newspapers list David Allen with 111 votes.

sub_unit.name: Three
sub_unit.note: Several newspapers list Henry Frey with 103 votes.

sub_unit.name: Clinton
sub_unit.note: In Clinton County votes for the individual candidates were not given, only the votes by party were given.

sub_unit.name: Champlain
sub_unit.note: The Republican Ticket received 33 votes and the Federalist Ticket received 55 votes in town of Champlain.

sub_unit.name: Chazy
sub_unit.note: The Republican Ticket received 26 votes and the Federalist Ticket received 34 votes in town of Chazy.

sub_unit.name: Mooers
sub_unit.note: The Republican Ticket received 13 votes and the Federalist Ticket received 16 votes in town of Mooers.

sub_unit.name: Peru
sub_unit.note: The Republican Ticket received 105 votes and the Federalist Ticket received 46 votes in town of Peru.

sub_unit.name: Plattsburgh
sub_unit.note: The Republican Ticket received 257 votes and the Federalist Ticket received 74 votes in town of Plattsburgh.

sub_unit.name: Franklin
sub_unit.note: In Franklin County votes for the individual candidates were not given, only the votes by party were given.

sub_unit.name: Chateaugay
sub_unit.note: The Republican Ticket received 19 votes and the Federalist Ticket received 34 votes in town of Chateugay.

sub_unit.name: Berlin
sub_unit.note: "The Senatorial votes from the town of Berlin are lost, in consequence of being returned after the time fixed by law." New-York Spectator (New York, NY). May 13, 1815.

sub_unit.name: Saratoga
sub_unit.note: In the votes for Benjamin Smith, in the town of Saratoga, there appears to be several typesetting problems. The vote is too high and was probably 121. Also, it looks to be too low in Milton, it appears that the last numbers of his votes in Halfmoon and Milton may have been reversed [226 and 120, being 220 and 126], all of which make his total 1446, being one off from the Official Canvass.

There were also several total differences in Saratoga County with the Official Canvass, where David Allen receives 1082 votes, Guert Van Schoonhaven receives 1492 votes and Ezra C. Gross receives 1460 votes.

election_record.reference: New-York Evening Post (New York, NY). April 29, 1815.
The Independent American (Ballston Spa, NY). May 10, 1815.
